Taylor Parsons wrote:
> Why would you not use HTTPS?  As a user I would *never* enter my credit 
> card number that was not on HTTPS.  I am relatively new to use REST, is 
> there something that would prevent you from using HTTPS?
>  

One more time everyone:

THIS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE CREDIT CARD NUMBER BEING SNIFFED IN TRANSIT.

THIS IS ABOUT THE CARD NUMBER (or other confidential data) BEING VIEWED
IN THE BROWSER'S LOCATION BAR LOCALLY.

HTTPS DOES NOTHING TO SOLVE THIS.

Several people have suggested obscuring the card number, but
unfortunately the user still has to type it in, and there's no easy way
to change it.

I think a lot of folks are missing the point. There is a lot of data
that might go in a secret field but is not a password. Can we GET such data?


--
